content: quote: Originally posted by mrmixitup: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: "The bill stems from a Michigan case where a woman who was carrying quadruplets stabbed and killed her boyfriend after he hit her in the stomach. The woman lost the babies and was convicted of manslaughter." Sounds about right. She wasn't convicted of murder. Some states don't allow self defense, some do. The "unborn child" thing is just window dressing...anything that would potentially kill the unborn children would potentially kill the mother. Oklahoma is just getting on the train they should've already been on. As far as Michigan, that's no surprise; not to make this a partisan issue, but states dominated by left-of-center demmos tend to take a dim view of self defense. If this happened in Alabama it wouldn't have even made it to court.
